snippet: The action by the Treasury was the fourth time in a week that the Obama administration escalated sanctions on Iran over its disputed nuclear program.
abstract: United States blacklists what it describes as global network of front companies controlled by Iran's top leaders, accusing them of hiding assets and generating billions of dollars' worth of revenue to help Tehran evade sanctions over its nuclear program; action marks fourth time in week that Obama administration has escalated sanctions and first time it accused Iranian leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei of directing an effort to bypass them.
lead_paragraph: The action by the Treasury was the fourth time in a week that the Obama administration escalated sanctions on Iran over its disputed nuclear program.

headline.seo: U.S. Sanctions 37 Companies in Iran Dispute
headline.main: U.S. Bans 37 Firms in Dispute With Iran
headline.print_headline: U.S. Bans 37 Firms In Dispute With Iran
